name: Arduino Ultrasonic Detection With Green LED Indicator
description: Arduino Nano connected with an HC-SR04 ultrasonic sensor and a green LED indicator. LED turns on based on simple detection logic.
connections: Arduino Nano powered via USB or regulated 5V
howItWorks: Arduino triggers the ultrasonic sensor and reads the echo time to calculate distance. If the distance meets predefined condition, the green LED lights up.
powerNotes: Arduino supplies 5V to HC-SR04 and LED.
safetyNotes: HC-SR04 must be powered only at 5V.
Avoid pointing sensor at soft materials; they absorb sound.
